summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, forwarding a corrected arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell. The email apologizes for a previous error and attaches the signed warrant.

persons.name: BYRNE
persons.context: Appears as the primary recipient of the email containing the corrected arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: PAU1
persons.context: Appears as a carbon copy recipient of the email containing the corrected arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual for whom the corrected arrest warrant is issued, as indicated by the attachment filename 'Maxwell_arrest_warrant_signed.pdf'.

events.title: Correction of Maxwell Arrest Warrant
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney sends a corrected version of the signed arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell via email, apologizing for a previous error.

locations.name: Southern District of New York
locations.context: The federal judicial district handling the case.

locations.name: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
locations.context: The address of the Assistant United States Attorney's office sending the email and warrant.

keyFacts: A corrected arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell was issued and sent by an Assistant United States Attorney on June 29, 2020.
The document indicates an error was made in a previous version of the arrest warrant, requiring a correction.
The warrant was signed, as indicated by the attachment filename 'Maxwell_arrest_warrant_signed.pdf'.
The correspondence originates from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, which was leading the prosecution.
